meanings.definition: Having a smooth, glossy texture like silk.
meanings.sent1: Her hair felt silkier after using the new conditioner.
meanings.sent2: The silkier fabric was more comfortable against her skin.
meanings.sent3: The cat's fur was so silkier that it looked like it had been polished.
meanings.sent4: The lake reflected the moonlight, creating a silkier surface than any mirror.
meanings.sent5: The chef's secret to a silkier sauce was adding a touch of cream.

meanings.sent1: The silkier road made for a more pleasant drive.
meanings.sent2: Her voice was silkier than velvet when she sang.
meanings.sent3: The silkier ice cream melted faster in the sun.
meanings.sent4: The silkier side of the pillow always seemed cooler.
meanings.sent5: The silkier touch of his hand reassured her in the darkness.
